column4: im having trouble with a nvidia video card giving me full resolution...the max i can have is 1200 x 800 but my screen goes way higher than that...any ideas...im using nvidia 180 drivers
using buntu 9.04
nvidia-settings
it could be that you have a crappy card.
if you have a good card, nvidia-settings works
im in nvidia x server settings right now...the max it will let me go is 1200 x 800 i have a 7600 gt
well, I would say then you cannot go higher.
it can also be the case that you need to add another resolution to the screen section of xorg.conf
but I personally doubt that is necessary.
there already should be a screen section in the xorg.conf file, just add the resolution you want to it.
and actionparsnip: im sure a 7600 gt is good enough for better htan 1200 x 800 res
pressing Control-Alt-+ you can do cycle through the resolutions.
and actionparsnip: im gonna pastebin my xorg.conf
and actionparsnip: http://pastebin.com/m7f8c613e
modprobe -r nvidia
or with sudo before it, depending on your setup.
can i pm your real quick?
no

if i download the fresh drivers from nvidia and go through the installation all i need to type is modprobe -r nvidia to fix it...cause before i got this after the installation....http://img38.imageshack.us/i/helpizj.jpg/
so, did you read the log?
yeah i didnt understand any of it...and then upgrayed from 8.10 to 9.04 and now im using the nvidia 180.44 drivers again
if you do not understand, you search for the error message on google.
you also read the README which has been written by nvidia, I think.
